Are phoenix life stages harder to notice than with other monsters, or do they just stay in stage 1 for a long time? I'm working on my first phoenix, and after a year it's still in stage 1 (as far as I can tell, anyway...it looks the same and its stat gains haven't changed). I got it from the phoenix feather- does that have anything to do with it?

By John Hawley on Wednesday, May 3, 2000 - 06:15 pm:

I just finished raising two of 'em and both stayed in Stage 1 nearly a year and a half. Neither grew before they went errant the first time.

By powerball on Friday, May 5, 2000 - 08:57 pm:

An update...my phoenix finally cracked the barrier into stage 2 a week after his second birthday! He's quite strong, with almost 700 intellegence already! Any suggestions as to which techs I should go for?

By Kurasu Soratubo on Friday, May 5, 2000 - 09:08 pm:

Depends on his skill. If it's high? Go for Heat Beam. That'll make your Phoenix a one hit wonder and then some. If not? The nearest hit tech you can get. My phoenixes have always been able to go the distance even without the life-loss of the specials (although I'll admit, Fire Wave is _very_ nice)

By torey_luvullo on Friday, May 5, 2000 - 10:05 pm:

with 700 int and high skill? i prefer fire wave, personally...

I keep getting the "may be difficult" message when I try to go on errantry. I got him down to evil, and I've used both flame shot and fire stream tons of times. Anyone know why I can't get these two techs?

By PezCat on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 02:52 pm:

to get Flame Cannon, though. My only 2 Phoenixes were both good natured...

By John Hawley on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 06:12 pm:

Keep trying, Powerball. Fire Stream and Flame Shot need to be used (not connect) 50 times. Stay Bad. You can get Fire Wave in any state, but you have to be over the line for Flame Cannon.
